criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all patient-reported adherence difficulties (forgetting to take mesalamine due to work, snoozing phone reminders) and clinician-suggested strategies (using phone reminders and a pill organizer).
Reward for faithfully recording the clinician’s stated plan and cautions (importance of consistency, try a pill organizer, report new symptoms or side-effects).

Reward for correctly incorporating relevant chart details that were contextually germane to the encounter (29-year-old male with Crohn’s disease on mesalamine 2.4 g daily) without importing unrelated chart information.
Reward for accurately capturing dosage, name, and schedule of mesalamine exactly as stated in the chart/transcript.
Penalize for omission of any major dialogue element: patient’s symptom–adherence correlation, clinician’s emphasis on consistency, or instruction to report new symptoms/side-effects.
Penalize for introduction of fabricated content, clinical assessments, plans, or background details not explicitly present or reasonably implied in the transcript or chart.
Penalize for selective or inaccurate copying from the chart—for example, inserting unrelated family history, allergies, or conditions, or misstating current medication details.
Penalize for any factual inaccuracies in names, ages, conditions, dosages, or timelines compared with the transcript or chart.
